scrape.title: The dinner
scrape.author: Jami
scrape.text: This book started out a little slow for me, but as I got into it, I became involved in the story, I don't want to give anything away, but this is definitely a dark and disturbing plot. The people who appear sympathetic at first may not be who they seem. It was an interesting way to tell the story, with references to the actual dinner/courses and flashbacks. Now that I am finished and reflect on the overall story, I can say that I really enjoyed this one. The references to Dutch culture also interested me; for example, the 18 year son telling his parents he carries a lighter to light girls' cigarettes and joints. I'm not sure I can picture that same conversation about joints in America! This is the first book I have read by this author, but I would definitely try another.
